page.topic: Marking and Deleting Selected Records in a Table

section.title: Marking and Unmarking Records
section.description: Using a form or browse, you can select a group of records by marking them. Marked records can be viewed, printed, or processed separately from other records. To mark a record, navigate to a record and press CTRL M or select Records > Mark. To unmark a record, navigate to a marked record and press CTRL U or select Records > Unmark. For example, you have a table of customer records and you want to send some of them bonus coupons. However, you only want to send coupons to your best customers. You can navigate from record-to-record and only mark the records of customers to whom you want to send coupons. Once the records are marked, you can print only those records by setting a range before printing.

section.title: Deleting and Undeleting Records
section.description: To delete records from a form or a browse:

step.description: If in a browse, select the records by dragging the Row Selector on the left edge of the screen.
Press CTRL D or select Edit > Delete.

section.note: After a Pack operation, records cannot be recovered.

section.description: You can un-delete records in a table or set, if the table or set has not yet been packed. Right-click on the table or set and select the Utilities > Undelete Records... .
